paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a BRCA2 variant associated with breast cancer and glioblastoma.

individual_records.phenotype_details: triple-negative invasive ductal carcinoma and glioblastoma
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Herein, we report a woman who is a carrier of a familial BRCA2 mutation, and was previously diagnosed with triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) and subsequently with a second primary TNBC and glioblastoma.

functional_data.summary: The specific functional impact of the c.1963del5 variant was not detailed in the paper.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is part of a familial mutation.
variants.additional_notes: The patient had a strong family history of breast cancer.
key_quotes: The patient is a 48-year-old woman with a family history of breast cancer, who had presented with a lump in her left breast 10 years previously.
However, when she was examined at our cancer center, genetic screening for BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations was performed, and a mutation (1963del5) was identified in the BRCA2 gene.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the BRCA2 variant.
